snippet: That amount will be only partly offset by an insurance payout of $38 million.
abstract: Target says in security filing that 2013 data breach has cost company $148 million in second quarter; reports that it expects earnings to drop to 78 cents a share, down from earlier projections of 85 cents to $1 a share; filing shows that breach, in which online thieves hacked into its computer system, continues to be drag on business.
lead_paragraph: That amount will be only partly offset by an insurance payout of $38 million.

headline.main: Target Puts Data Breach Costs at $148 Million, and Forecasts Profit Drop
headline.print_headline: Target Puts Data Breach Costs at $148 Million, and Forecasts Profit Drop
